heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.8°C), outside temperature (down 4.3°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 11178 lux) and cloud levels (up 555 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12482 lux) and cloud levels (up 1123 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 555.4m lower than yesterday, 737.5m lower than the past week, 1122.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 866m and a peak of 3020m, averaging 1161.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Weather could become unsettled.
